name: Login Success Rate
description: Percentage of login attempts that result in a successful authentication.

alignment.why_it_matters: Indicates friction in authentication flow and its impact on user access.

definition.formula_detail: Count of successful login events divided by all login attempts within the selected time window.

tradeoffs: Increasing security challenge frequency can negatively impact this metric.

decision_use_cases: Identify login issues impacting access to digital channels.
Trigger incident triage when success rate drops below critical threshold.

metadata.notes: Monitor this metric closely during authentication system changes or deployments.

example_queries.query: SELECT DATE(event_time) as date, COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'success' THEN 1 END) / COUNT(*) as success_rate FROM events_logins WHERE event_time >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL 30 DAY GROUP BY DATE(event_time)

name: API Response Time (P95)
description: 95th percentile response time for API requests, indicating the performance experienced by most users.

alignment.why_it_matters: API performance directly impacts user experience and downstream service dependencies.

definition.formula_detail: Calculate the 95th percentile of all API response times during the measurement window.

tradeoffs: Adding more validation or processing increases response time but improves data quality.

decision_use_cases: Validate impact of code deployments on API performance

metadata.notes: This is a Service Level Indicator (SLI) that contributes to our API availability SLO.

name: Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR)
description: Total value of recurring revenue normalized to a one-year period.

alignment.why_it_matters: Primary metric for measuring business scale and growth trajectory.

definition.formula_detail: Sum of all active subscription MRR values multiplied by 12 to annualize.

tradeoffs: Aggressive discounting can increase ARR short-term but may impact margins.

decision_use_cases: Sales target setting and quota allocation

metadata.notes: ARR is the single most important metric for SaaS business valuation and health.

example_queries.query: SELECT SUM(mrr * 12) as arr FROM subscriptions WHERE status = 'active' AND as_of_date = CURRENT_DATE

name: Customer Churn Rate
description: Percentage of customers who cancel or do not renew their subscriptions in a given period.

alignment.why_it_matters: Customer retention is more cost-effective than acquisition and directly impacts revenue stability.

definition.formula_detail: Number of customers who churned during the period divided by total customers at the beginning of the period.

tradeoffs: Aggressive retention discounts can reduce churn but impact margins.

decision_use_cases: Identify at-risk customer segments requiring intervention

metadata.notes: Track both voluntary and involuntary churn separately for deeper insights.

example_queries.query: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', churn_date) as month, COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) / LAG(COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id)) OVER (ORDER BY month) as churn_rate FROM subscriptions WHERE churn_date IS NOT NULL GROUP BY month

name: Deployment Frequency
description: Number of successful production deployments per time period, indicating team velocity and continuous delivery maturity.

alignment.why_it_matters: Higher deployment frequency correlates with faster feature delivery and improved engineering practices.

definition.formula_detail: Count all successful production deployments and divide by the measurement period.

tradeoffs: Increasing deployment frequency without proper testing can increase failure rates.

decision_use_cases: Measure DevOps maturity and improvement over time
Compare team performance and identify bottlenecks

metadata.notes: This is one of the four key DORA metrics for measuring DevOps performance.

example_queries.query: SELECT DATE(deployment_time) as date, COUNT(*) as deployments FROM deployments WHERE environment = 'production' AND status = 'success' GROUP BY date

name: Customer Satisfaction Score (CSAT)
description: Measure of customer satisfaction based on post-interaction surveys, typically on a 5-point scale.

alignment.why_it_matters: Direct indicator of customer happiness and likelihood to continue using the product.

definition.formula_detail: Average of all customer satisfaction ratings collected through post-interaction surveys.

tradeoffs: Pushing for higher CSAT may slow down resolution times.

decision_use_cases: Identify areas for customer experience improvement
Track impact of product changes on satisfaction

metadata.notes: CSAT is collected immediately after key interactions (purchase, support, etc.).

name: System Uptime
description: Percentage of time the system is available and operational over a given period.

alignment.why_it_matters: System availability directly impacts customer trust and revenue.

definition.formula_detail: Percentage of time the system was operational and accessible to users.

tradeoffs: Maintenance windows reduce uptime but improve long-term reliability.

metadata.notes: This is a key SLI for our 99.9% uptime SLO commitment.

name: Customer Lifetime Value (LTV)
description: Predicted total revenue that a customer will generate over their entire relationship with the company.

alignment.why_it_matters: LTV helps determine customer acquisition spend limits and long-term business health.

definition.formula_detail: Average revenue per user multiplied by average customer lifetime (inverse of churn rate).

tradeoffs: Aggressive upselling can increase LTV but may increase churn if not handled carefully.

metadata.notes: LTV should be compared with CAC to ensure sustainable unit economics.

name: Trial to Paid Conversion Rate
description: Percentage of trial users who convert to paying customers.

alignment.why_it_matters: Indicates product-market fit and effectiveness of trial experience.

definition.formula_detail: Number of trial users who became paid customers divided by total trial starts.

tradeoffs: Shorter trial periods may increase urgency but could reduce conversion if users need more time.

decision_use_cases: Evaluate effectiveness of sales outreach during trial

metadata.notes: Track cohort-based conversion rates to understand time-to-convert patterns.

name: Pull Request Cycle Time
description: Average time from PR creation to merge, measuring development velocity and review efficiency.

alignment.why_it_matters: Faster cycle times enable quicker feature delivery and reduce context switching.

definition.formula_detail: Average time elapsed between PR creation and merge for all merged PRs.

tradeoffs: Rushing reviews to reduce cycle time can impact code quality.

decision_use_cases: Identify bottlenecks in code review process
Compare team performance and identify best practices

metadata.notes: Smaller PRs typically have faster cycle times. Track PR size separately.

name: Code Coverage
description: Percentage of code lines covered by automated tests.

alignment.why_it_matters: Higher test coverage reduces bugs and enables confident refactoring.

definition.formula_detail: Percentage of executable code lines that are executed by automated tests.

tradeoffs: High coverage doesn't guarantee quality if tests are not meaningful.

decision_use_cases: Enforce minimum coverage requirements in CI/CD

metadata.notes: Focus on meaningful tests rather than just hitting coverage percentages.

name: Bug Escape Rate
description: Number of bugs found in production per release, indicating test effectiveness.

alignment.why_it_matters: Lower escape rates indicate better testing and reduce customer impact.

definition.formula_detail: Average number of bugs discovered in production per release.

tradeoffs: More thorough testing reduces escape rate but may slow delivery velocity.

decision_use_cases: Identify quality trends by service or team

metadata.notes: Track by severity to focus on critical and high severity bugs separately.
